Dear Tishara Price:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Description • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/21/25, two youth had a visitation at the DHHS office with
their parent. One of the youths leaned against the wall and
accidentally turned a light off. A staff member pushed the youth in
the stomach using both hands, causing the youth to fall down.
The other youth tried leaving the visit room and the staff member
swung out her arm and hit the youth, causing them to fall.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
District Manager was interviewed by video conferencing on
6/3/2025. She reported she is Office Manager’s direct supervisor.
She stated she heard Foster Care Worker was supervising a visit
and wanted assistance, so Office Manager offered to help. District
Manager stated Office Manager does not supervise visits, this was
just a “place and time situation.” District Manager stated she has
talked to Office Manager about this and the plan moving forward is
to track someone down who can assist with a visit when needed.
District Manager stated she has spoken to Office Manager about
the allegations, which she denied. District Manager stated she has
had no concerns with Office Manager’s performance and can’t see
her doing anything like what is alleged to have occurred. District
Manager stated there are cameras in the visit rooms and she will
have to look into if/how long the footage is saved. On 6/18/2025,
District Manager sent an email stating the agency does not have
video footage of their visitation room.
Office Manager was interviewed by video conferencing on
5/30/2025. She reported receiving a call from Foster Care
Worker’s supervisor on 4/21/2025 stating she was trying to get
reach the supervisor assigned to be in the building that day
because a parent was causing issues during a parenting time visit.
Office Manager stated she couldn’t reach anyone, so she walked
around until she found a supervisor who she brought to the visit
room to assist Foster Care Worker. Foster Care Worker came out
of the room to take the female youths for water and asked Office
Manager if she could stay in the room with the male youths. The
supervisor had taken the mother to different room, so Office
2

Manager was alone in the room with youths. She stated she was
sitting on the arm of the couch near the door to the room. She
reported the mother, Foster Care Worker, and the female youths
returned to the room and Office Manager stayed. She stated
Youth B accidentally leaned against the light switch and turned the
light off then immediately turned it back on. Office Manager
showed a picture of the light switch in relation to where she was
sitting and explained she would have had to walk over to where
Youth B was to touch her, but Office Manager never left her spot
on the arm of the couch. She denied ever touching Youth B,
stating she did not go near her when this occurred. Office
Manager stated when there was five minutes left of the visit, the
family started to clean up, but Youth A started playing with Jenga
blocks on a table at the other end of the couch from where Office
Manager was sitting. Office Manager asked him to help clean up.
She stated when they left the room at the end of the visit, Youth A
was the first to leave the room and Youth B was lagging behind,
so Office Manager walked behind her. Office Manager stated
Youth A had not attempted to leave the visit room at any other
time while she was in the room. Office Manager stated the mother
and a friend of hers were talking in the hallway and asked for
space, so Office Manager told them the building was closed so
they needed to continue their conversation in the parking lot at
which time they left. Office Manager stated there are cameras in
the visit rooms, but she is unsure if they record or if it just a live
feed.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed by video conferencing on
6/5/2025. She reported she was supervising a visit with the five
youths and their mother on 4/21/2025 at the MDHHS office.
During the visit, the mother became verbally aggressive with
Foster Care Worker, so she sent a text message to her supervisor
asking if anyone was in the office to assist her. A supervisor from
another department was in the building and she came to the visit
room then left the room with the mother to bring her into a different
room to talk. Two of the youths needed to use the bathroom, so
Foster Care Worker brought them and asked Office Manager to
stay in the room with the remaining three youths. Foster Care
Worker stated she was out of the room for approximately 5-7
minutes. When Foster Care Worker returned to the room, Office
Manager remained in the room for the remainder of the visit to
provide support. She stated Office Manager was sitting on the arm
of the couch in the room nearest the door. As it got close to the
end of the visit, Foster Care Worker told the family it was time to
start cleaning up. She stated once the visit was over and everyone
left the room, Foster Care Worker had to keep prompting the
3

family to leave the hallway as it was after hours, and the building
was closed. She stated this was all done verbally, and there was
no touching involved.
After the visit, Foster Care Worker got a call from the youths’
caregiver who put Youth A on the phone. Youth A reported Office
Manager shoved him and Youth B with her hands, knocking them
down. Foster Care Worker stated no injuries were reported. Foster
Care Worker did not ask any questions and immediately reported
the allegations.
Youth A was interviewed by phone on 6/11/2025. He stated he
remembered having a visit at the office with Office Manager
present, but that he “didn’t remember what happened.” He stated
his mom “grabbed up” his sibling and Office Manager told her “you
can’t do that,” but his mom didn’t do it hard. He stated Office
Manager was near the door listening to everything Youth B said to
his mom. He denied ever trying to leave the room during the visit.
Youth B was interviewed by phone on 6/11/2025. She stated she
remembered the visit with Office Manager present. She stated
Office Manager was in the visit room sitting down throughout the
visit. Youth B reported accidentally hitting the light switch with her
elbow. Youth B stated she told her mom Office Manager pushed
her elbow away from the light switch. Youth B stated it didn’t hurt,
and Office Manager was just trying to move Youth B’s elbow away
from the light.
Analysis The agency is found to be in compliance with Office Manager
demonstrating responsible character and suitability/ability as,
during their investigation interviews, no one reported Office
Manager pushing or knocking anyone down during their
interviews.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
June 18, 2025
____________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
June 20, 2025
